revised_title: Gas Vesicles: Lower Limit of Gas Permeability and Rapid Gas Diffusion
tldr: The authors investigated the gas permeability of gas vesicles found in planktonic prokaryotes, specifically Anabaena flos-aquae. They discovered that gas vesicles can rapidly diffuse gases and survive rapid pressure changes. The study provides a minimum estimate of the permeability of gas vesicles to gases, suggesting that they have many pores allowing for gas diffusion.
